column2: MrsJackson, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this pill for almost a year now for FSGS(nephrotic syndrome). I had huge amount of fluid in my stomach and other parts. After taking this for a few months I went from 160 back to my 115 weight. I had no side effects at all like I did when my doctor tried Cyclosporine. This drug turned my labs back to normal and made my weekly kidney appt to 4-5 months apart. GREAT DRUG!!

column2: barb2rick, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: At first lowered my IGG with 1mg, but on   2 mg my IGG has increased.

column2: surfer, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have had a transplant for 9 years now and have had great success but for these dam skin problems...it sucks being a surfer with a transplant because I am at the skin doc every other week getting shiot removed.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: this treatment is awsome.  I love drugs.

column2: bak2good, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been on this medication since I was 19 due to a liver transplant. I had the tremors and the headaches in the beginning but they went away after about a year I believe. It was rather annoying but I was still alive! It has been 13 almost 14 years now and I have had only one rejection episode. That was due to mixing non-compatible meds. My meds have just been reduced to 1mg 2x daily. That is the ONLY anti-rejection drug I am on and things are going well. I can only hope to make it another 40-50 years this way. Please feel free to contact me if you want to know more about my experience with this medication. bak2good at yahoo.com. Thanks- BB

column2: randysandy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on Tacrolimus since my Kidney/Pancreas Transplant in May of 2002.  This is, quite honestly, the best drug that I'm taking right now and I've NEVER had any rejection.  I lost the transplanted pancreas in Feb 2003, however, that was due to thrombosis when a blood clot moved into the artery and blocked the blood flow to that particular organ.....but my new kidney rocks!!!

column2: BOBBI, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: my FK level is 14.6  after a 13 hour of not taking any prograf....Is this OK?

column2: wolfe,  Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I really did not feel well because I newly experienced tremor. After switching to an alternative (ciclo) symptoms very quickly ceased.

column2: ali, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Caregiver)
geo.fee@juno.com, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years
column9: Since my Transplant,heart, Oct. 2001, I've had only one or two Rejections. I was placed on Prograf after having experienced numerous rejections the first months of my Transplant. I was apparently rejecting the Meds, not the heart!!
